casebody.data:
COOPER
v.
BERGER, et al. 52PA17-3 Supreme Court of North Carolina. March 13, 2018 D. Martin Warf, Attorney at Law, Noah H. Huffstetler, III, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Candace S. Friel, Attorney at Law, Winston-Salem, for Berger, Philip E. Jim W. Phillips, Jr., Attorney at Law, Greensboro, Eric M. David, Attorney at Law, Daniel F.E. Smith, Attorney at Law, for Cooper, Roy A (III). Grayson Kelley, Chief Deputy. Alexander McC. Peters, Special Deputy Attorney General, Alexander McC. Peters, Senior Deputy Attorney General, Wake County Superior Court, District Attorney, for State of North Carolina. John R. Wester, Attorney at Law, Adam K. Doerr, Attorney at Law, Kevin Crandall, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, J. Dickson Phillips, III, Attorney at Law, Chapel Hill, for Hunt, James B., Jr., et al. Andrew H. Erteschik, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, Wendy R. Weiser, Attorney at Law, Daniel I. Weiner, Attorney at Law, Wilfred U. Codrington, III, Attorney at Law, Brent Ferguson, Attorney at Law, for Brennan Center for Justice at NYU School of Law, et al. Allison J. Riggs, Attorney at Law, Anita S. Earls, Attorney at Law, Emily E. Seawell, Attorney at Law, for County Board Members.

The following order has been entered on the motion filed on the 6th of March 2018 by Plaintiff to Enforce Mandate:

"Motion Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 13th of March 2018."
